intro: Brucea macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf Brucea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small yellow flowers. Brucea macrophylla is often found in tropical forests and is known for its medicinal properties. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antimalarial effects.
